data.title: Kiskatom Marriages
data.text:
Kiskatom Reformed

Church

Marriages 1842-1937

Transcribed by Audrey Klinkenberg from the original records and contributed by Jane Freese

The information includes date of marriage, name, age and residence of husband, name, age and residence of bride. Later records indicate where the ceremony took place and the fee. Comments surrounded by ( ) are found in original book, but not reproduced in photocopy, perhaps in margins.

The above a hard case - Jackson indicted in Uster Co. for bigamy and the Dominie a witness to identify him - and yet cleared on the ground of a tecknicality in the indictment by a county lawyer for whose principle in the case no praise can be given by any of noble character. Some lawyers come pr. or are kept from obscurity only by a dirty coniving. The day comes wh. will by every man's work of wh. sort it is.
